project.teaser: The BOOST4BIOEAST project aims to set in motion the levers for bioeconomy deployment in the Central Eastern European and Baltic countries. The consortium will focus on building upon BIOEASTsUP outcomes and the Vision Paper of the BIOEAST Initiative by boosting the...
project.objective: The BOOST4BIOEAST project aims to set in motion the levers for bioeconomy deployment in the Central Eastern European and Baltic countries. The consortium will focus on building upon BIOEASTsUP outcomes and the Vision Paper of the BIOEAST Initiative by boosting the participation of national stakeholder networks in the development of national bioeconomy action plans and to build long-lasting structures for national and macro-regional cooperation. The BIOEAST HUBs will be the national platforms directly linked to public administrations under which capacities are built and the different stakeholders of the bioeconomy are mobilised to more effectively contribute to and take part in decision-making processes using participatory approaches. BIOEAST-wide mapping of bioeconomy competencies and biomass will be undertaken to advance the knowledge on bioeconomy in the macro-region as well as BIOEAST Knowledge Platform will be created to act as repository of knowledge materials and relevant information on bioeconomy that will allow BIOEAST´s stakeholders to access, share and store bioeconomy-related materials towards developing national BIOEAST HUBs into active contributors to bioeconomy in each member state. In order to boost bioeconomy innovation and education in the BIOEAST countries, the project will bring together public and private funders with relevant business stakeholders and expand the BIOEAST UNI NET network. Activities such as training, reskilling, awareness spreading and communication channels creation will set the basis of the bioeconomic transition, creating spaces of dialogue and involvement among all agents of the industry (academia, private and public), which will boost the stakeholders engagement for the integration of programmes and policies in turn of bioeconomy. The hereby proposed consortium is composed of stakeholders of all BIOEAST member states along with partners distributed throughout Western Europe (BE, FI, GER, IE, IT& ES).
project.title: BOOSTing the bioeconomy transformation FOR (4) the BIOEAST region
project.keywords: Regional development, social innovation, policy development, stakeholder engagement, co-creation, investments, biobased value chains, biomass, educational needs, action plan, BIOEAST

article.title: Cooperation of BIOEAST countries to transition to sustainable bioeconomies

result.title: Communication and Dissemination and Exploitation Activities Report
result.description: This deliverable will specify DEC activities and monitor and evaluate them against KPIs and plan the next DEC steps for the rest of the project.

result.title: Ready to use education materials in bioeconomy, needs and gaps
result.description: D5.1 will consolidate the mapping results of the bioeconomy-related knowledge, educational materials and needs in the BIOEAST countries.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BOOST4BIOEAST (BOOSTing the bioeconomy transformation FOR (4) the BIOEAST region)
result.teaser: BOOST4BIOEAST is designed to boost the participation of national stakeholder networks in the development of national bioeconomy action plans, and to set-up long-lasting structures for cooperation and networking in the BIOEAST macro-region. The project supports the BIOEAST...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: BIOEAST HUB Handbook
result.description: D2.1 will describe the methodological approach for creating and running HUBs, the proposed portfolio of HUB activities, common reporting procedures, country-specific stakeholder engagement and best practice recommendations.

result.title: AP methodology
result.description: D7.1 will describe the pilot-tested, general Action Plan method to be adopted by the HUBs containing methods, online and offline collaborative working tools and working templates.

result.title: HUB Terms of References
result.description: D2.2 will collect, assess and compare the terms of references of 11 HUBs describing rationale, vision, goals, activities, topical areas roles, benefits and expectations, basic internal rules and procedures, including for the creation of HUB working groups.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination and Exploitation Strategy
result.description: This deliverable will define the DEC goals, the tools, the targeted audience, the visual identity, the approaches (content and channels), and the time-plan that the project partners will follow to optimise the outreach of the project’s engagement activities, ensuring the visibility of the project’s results. Moreover, this deliverable will include a map of all the projects exploitable outputs identified, along with a networking strategy to establish how to engage with other projects and initiatives.

result.title: Risk Management Plan
result.description: D1.1 defines the project risk management process from risk identification, assessment, associated mitigation measures, contingency plans to montioring activities to reduce their negative impact.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: D1.2 describes how the data gained or produced will be handled, analyzed, and stored during the course of a project.

result.title: Bioeconomy related innovation ecosystem mapping
result.description: D4.1 will include the pattern of the eco-innovative capitals throughout the BIOEAST countries, and the financial opportunities and barriers to their access. The report will also contain policy recommendations as well as fact sheets on access to basic application information on public and private funding and financing opportunities.

result.title: Results from multi-dimensional competency and biomass mapping
result.description: D3.1 will consolidate the results of bioeconomy-related competency, biomass availability and uses mapping from the BIOEAST countries.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
